meanings.definition: To adopt or take up again
meanings.sent1: After losing his dog, he decided to readopt a new puppy from the shelter.
meanings.sent2: The family made the heartwarming decision to readopt their foster child.
meanings.sent3: The toy was readopted by the child after being lost in the park.
meanings.sent4: She readopted her old hobby of painting, finding comfort in familiar strokes.
meanings.sent5: The library readopted the policy of late fees to encourage timely returns.

meanings.sent1: The store allowed customers to readopt items for a full refund.
meanings.sent2: He had to readopt his apology after realizing he had been too harsh.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully tried to readopt the toy mouse from the curious kitten.
meanings.sent4: She readopted her initial decision, realizing it was the right choice all along.
meanings.sent5: The teacher readopted the student's late assignment, showing understanding and flexibility.

meanings.sent1: The team captain decided to readopt the winning strategy for the next game.
meanings.sent2: She was thrilled to readopt her favorite book for the book club's next meeting.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant readopted the popular dish due to customer demand.
meanings.sent4: He readopted his old routine, finding comfort in familiarity.
meanings.sent5: The town council voted to readopt the recycling program, promoting sustainability.
